title: Why most activation metrics don't predict who will stay
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 11 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.revenuecat.com%2Fblog%2Fgrowth%2Factivation-metrics%2F%3Futm_source=tldrmarketing/1/0100019c0ecc4a52-f768877c-f06c-4ff0-97bc-106cda060e86-000000/AtaSH51qDan-NTPLUrzQZbE2bw-yrvrB0QzqeiFgoAM=442
summary: Why most activation metrics don't predict who will stay (11 minute read) Most activation metrics fail because they track steps or engagement, not whether users reach meaningful value. Signups, onboarding, or session length can look good while users drop off or never convert. True activation happens when users experience early and sustained value. Measuring first value and core value moments shows who is likely to stay. Focus on behaviors that drive long-term subscribers.

title: Deep dive into Turso, the "SQLite rewrite in Rust"
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fkerkour.com%2Fturso-sqlite%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019c0ecf9486-291c6964-facc-46f3-82cc-945f66787227-000000/ywtsBTjFCoXEkI55AjgT8C_cWP8c8oIjnXXTipwW5aI=442
summary: Deep dive into Turso, the "SQLite rewrite in Rust" (7 minute read) Turso is a database engine written in Rust. Designed as a rewrite of SQLite, it resolves SQLite's issues, such as a closed test suite, lack of concurrent writes, and C's memory management problems, by having built-in encryption, MVCC support, and the safety benefits of Rust. Unlike SQLite, Turso has the ability to scale from an in-process embedded database to a networked, cloud-hosted solution.

title: Fixing TypeScript Performance Problems: A Case Study
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 9 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.viget.com%2Farticles%2Ffixing-typescript-performance-problems%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019c0ecf9486-291c6964-facc-46f3-82cc-945f66787227-000000/FN2sExTDGVBXpka5_LqC4M2xEj7ZCFmo6lwTa8k0pU4=442
summary: Fixing TypeScript Performance Problems: A Case Study (9 minute read) Viget's TypeScript monorepo had become painfully slow, so its team used `tsc --generateTrace` to find one file taking 80 seconds to type-check. They deleted parts of the file with complex type inference, inlined queries within the file which previously required expensive type-checking, and cleaned up circular deps and barrel files.

title: Backseat Software
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 22 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fblog.mikeswanson.com%2Fbackseat-software%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019c0ecf9486-291c6964-facc-46f3-82cc-945f66787227-000000/OeK6-veOuxDVPfBcHWdj3-HnqrFvxObZHQ__2phy5kU=442
summary: Backseat Software (22 minute read) Modern software has devolved into "backseat software" that constantly interrupts and tries to manage user behavior. This evolution began with the internet enabling updates and telemetry, gradually escalating as companies prioritized optimizing engagement metrics through measurement, A/B testing, and pervasive nudges. The ideal alternative to this is quiet that respects user attention and treats communication as opt-in.

title: Software is Mostly All You Need
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 11 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fsoftwarefordays.com%2Fpost%2Fsoftware-is-mostly-all-you-need%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdev/1/0100019c0ecf9486-291c6964-facc-46f3-82cc-945f66787227-000000/l3-e1rFt8UQP45oEMUMDHmnBdZEUo9P2R9hXc5Mkw4E=442
summary: Software is Mostly All You Need (11 minute read) AI coding agents are amazing at writing software. title: The Fundability Trap
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 17 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Finsights.euclid.vc%2Fp%2Fthe-fundability-trap%3Futm_source=tldrfounders/1/0100019c0f045dd3-2611ee66-0bc3-42f7-8116-c48577dbf11f-000000/pfCDhQhdJQa9syeXH6QdWavPkpNSAMd2rXtlbaAUidI=442
summary: The Fundability Trap (17 minute read) Fundability is the measure of how well a startup fits with the current venture consensus. Investability is a measure of potential outcome and financial return. VCs that conflate the two or don't recognize the difference risk building an entire ecosystem that rewards fundability. Chasing fundability over investability has never been a reliable path to outlier outcomes and fund returns.

title: Trust minimized transaction simulation using state proofs
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 2 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fethresear.ch%2Ft%2Ftrust-minimized-transaction-simulation-using-state-proofs%2F23857%23post_2%3Futm_source=tldrcrypto/1/0100019c0f16ebea-235538ea-67bb-44cc-952c-f17bf049dc55-000000/dr_qYgZYCxvQrr-673wtNyb_0qIuezlV3qL21NLWOkg=442
summary: Trust minimized transaction simulation using state proofs (2 minute read) Wallet simulations currently depend on vulnerable RPC providers for state data. Deploying Merkle Patricia Trie proofs and multi-node consensus enables cryptographic prestate verification before execution. This trust-minimized architecture eliminates single points of failure, providing users with verifiable security when previewing transactions before signing.

title: Agent Trace: Capturing the Context Graph of Code
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-01-30, Reading time: 5 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fcognition.ai%2Fblog%2Fagent-trace%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019c0f450cdd-d6d47f58-1fe9-4ad5-8928-20edf4f6f1f4-000000/iM_J_Hc9V41OTmAcIQf32uIpvuvmNmCB_m4h0vLQPZk=442
summary: Agent Trace: Capturing the Context Graph of Code (5 minute read) Agent Trace is an open, vendor-neutral spec for recording AI contributions alongside human authorship in version-controlled codebases. summary: Fact checking Moravec's paradox (15 minute read) Moravec's paradox, an endlessly repeated aphorism that tasks that are hard for humans are easy for AI and vice versa, is really just a statement on what the AI community finds worthwhile to work on and doesn't have any predictive power about which problems are going to be easy or hard for AI.

summary: How I Structure My Data Pipelines: The Silver Layer (12 minute read) The Silver layer combines Medallion (Bronze-Silver-Gold) with Kimball dimensional modeling, serving as the core by organizing data into business-domain schemas with facts (granular events) and dimensions (attributes with surrogate keys), using intermediates for reusable transformations, and RLS/CLM access controls. This design ensures predictability, schema evolution, isolation of business logic in Silver, and composability.

summary: Dash (GitHub Repo) Dash is a self-learning data agent that grounds its answers in six layers of context and continuously improves with every use. It addresses the common shortcomings of raw LLMs in generating SQL, which often fail due to missing context, lack of tribal knowledge, and inability to learn from errors. Dash achieves this by integrating context layers and a unique self-learning loop, which stores both curated "Knowledge" and discovered "Learnings" from past interactions.

title: Dollar Stablecoins Are a Geopolitical Weapon
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-02, Reading time: 1 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fthreadreaderapp.com%2Fthread%2F2017625827861549107.html%3Futm_source=tldrcrypto/1/0100019c1e77f043-d31719ec-e930-454f-a18e-61c45b73d959-000000/ezvCcb_blF76ECRrPMx72p5kAi23c58_D5Kybnv39QA=442
summary: Dollar Stablecoins Are a Geopolitical Weapon (1 minute read) Dollar stablecoins let the US export dollar liquidity without sending physical dollars. Foreign firms hand local FX to a US issuer, the issuer converts it into dollars, buys T-bills, and issues stablecoins. This creates a COMECON-style settlement loop that funnels dollars into US Treasuries and could let the US sidestep the Triffin dilemma by making stablecoins a strategic geopolitical tool.

summary: Synthetic pretraining (28 minute read) Synthetic pretraining is the large-scale use of synthetic data sources throughout training. It is a practical response to the fact that it is difficult to collect data that reliably produces the capabilities we want. summary: Dissecting the Internet's Most Novel Creature (6 minute read) Moltbook is an AI-only social network where tens of thousands of AI agents post and comment while humans observe. The platform grew from 42 posts per day to 36,905 in 72 hours. Social networks typically have 90% of users lurking, 9% contributing occasionally, and 1% creating the most content. AI agents are breaking that pattern. This post takes a look at posts made on the platform and how they differ from human-run social networks.

summary: Claude Code's renderer is more complex than a game engine (12 minute read) Through profiling, Claude Code was found to spend 70% of its time on `futex` calls and make 89,000 `sched_yield` calls, showing inefficient thread spinning rather than proper I/O waiting. title: Reko
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2026-02-03, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fuxmal%2Freko%3Futm_source=tldrinfosec/1/0100019c23d49a3d-252bbb72-0117-47f0-ab11-86001d99ce31-000000/Pq88AfhNV63rBBgEri3AzH6DLCAZMCn1EvEfZotBi-Y=443
summary: Reko (GitHub Repo) Reko is a general-purpose, open-source decompiler for machine code binaries that supports multiple processor architectures and executable file formats with minimal user intervention. Built on .NET 6.0, it provides command-line, Windows GUI, and ASP.NET front ends for analyzing and decompiling binary executables. Licensed under GPL, it is particularly useful for reverse engineering and binary analysis workflows where legal rights to decompile are established.
